title: Chickpea Salad
ingredients: Salt, pepper, olive oil, and lemon juice to taste
preparation: Wash all vegetables thoroughly.
Chop them as desired.
In a large bowl, combine chickpeas with vegetables and season to taste.

title: Radish Salad
ingredients: Light semi-soft cheese, cubed (Port Salut or similar)
Salt, pepper, and olive oil to taste
preparation: Wash all vegetables thoroughly.
Slice or chop as desired.
Toss with lemon juice, cheese, and seasonings.

title: Spiral Veggie Salad
ingredients: Salt, pepper, olive oil, and vinegar to taste
preparation: Wash all vegetables thoroughly.
Slice into thin rounds or spirals.
Arrange on a plate and season to taste.

title: Tuna Salad
ingredients: 1 tuna fillet, cooked, or 1 can (5 oz) tuna in water, drained
Salt, pepper, olive oil, and lemon juice to taste
preparation: Wash all vegetables thoroughly.
Chop as desired.
Combine with tuna and season to taste.

title: Lentil and Brown Rice Salad
ingredients: Salt, pepper, olive oil, and vinegar to taste
preparation: Wash vegetables thoroughly.
Chop vegetables and spinach.
In a large bowl, combine rice, lentils, and vegetables.
Season to taste and toss well.

title: Pea and Corn Salad
ingredients: Salt, pepper, olive oil, and vinegar to taste
preparation: Wash vegetables thoroughly.
Shred cabbage and halve cherry tomatoes.
Chop hard-boiled eggs.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and season to taste.

title: Pasta and Veggie Salad
ingredients: Salt, pepper, olive oil, and vinegar to taste
preparation: Wash all vegetables thoroughly.
Chop cucumber, tomato, and arugula.
Combine with cooked pasta and season to taste.

title: Broccoli and Arugula Salad
ingredients: Salt, pepper, olive oil, and vinegar to taste
preparation: Wash all vegetables thoroughly.
Chop broccoli, arugula, tomatoes, and cabbage as desired.
Combine in a large bowl and season to taste.

title: Quinoa Veggie Salad
preparation: Wash all vegetables thoroughly.
Chop or shred as indicated.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa with vegetables.
Season with lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Toss well.

title: Adzuki Bean Salad
ingredients: Olive oil and seasonings to taste
preparation: Soak adzuki beans for 8–12 hours.
Discard soaking water and place beans in a pot.
Add boiling water and cook over medium heat for at least 30 minutes or until tender.
Place cooked adzuki in a bowl, add sprouts, greens, and halved cherry tomatoes.
Season to taste.

title: Tabbouleh Salad
preparation: Place bulgur in a bowl with boiling water and let soak 10–15 minutes until grains swell.
Drain and squeeze out excess water.
In a bowl, combine bulgur with remaining ingredients.
Season with salt, pepper, olive oil, and lemon juice.

title: Multicolor Salad
ingredients: Salt, pepper, and olive oil to taste
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Season to taste and toss gently.

title: Whole Wheat Pie Crust
preparation: Mix flour with salt and olive oil.
Gradually add warm water until dough forms.
Knead the dough.
Let rest for a few minutes, then roll out.

title: Broccoli and Pumpkin Tart
ingredients: Filling: 1 cup pumpkin or butternut squash, diced
preparation: Wash and chop broccoli and squash as indicated.
Steam or boil until tender.
Sauté the onion.
In a bowl, combine vegetables with beaten egg and seasonings.
Fill the whole wheat crust, top with cheese cubes and sesame seeds.
Bake at 350°F until golden.

title: Vegan Ratatouille Tart
ingredients: Filling: Black pepper and salt to taste
preparation: Wash and slice all vegetables thinly.
Roast them in the oven or on a grill pan.
Arrange on the crust in a spiral pattern.
Bake a few minutes until crust is golden.

title: Pumpkin Crust Tart
ingredients: Crust: 1.6 lbs pumpkin or butternut squash
preparation: Cut squash and steam or microwave until tender.
Steam spinach and squeeze out all water.
Sauté the onion.
Mash squash and mix with shredded carrot, egg, and seasonings.
Spread into a greased pie dish and bake at 350°F for about 12 minutes until surface sets.
Mix chopped spinach with sautéed onion and remaining filling ingredients.
Pour over crust and bake at 350°F for about 35 minutes until set.

title: Spinach and Ricotta Tart
ingredients: 1 cup cooked spinach, drained and chopped
preparation: Beat eggs with seasonings.
Mix with spinach and ricotta.
Assemble tart with filling and whole wheat crust.
Bake until crust is golden.
notes: Tip: Freeze in portions for easy meal prep.

title: Tuna Tart
ingredients: 1 can (5 oz) tuna in water, drained
preparation: In a nonstick wok or pan, sauté onion with bell peppers.
Mix with tuna and tomato.
Assemble the tart.
Bake at 350°F until golden.

title: Eggplant Tart
preparation: Sauté garlic with onion.
Add tomatoes and eggplants.
Cover and cook over low heat for 15 minutes.
Beat eggs with cream cheese and seasonings.
Mix egg mixture with eggplant preparation.
Assemble the tart and bake.

title: Vegetable and Quinoa Soup
preparation: Finely chop all vegetables.
In a nonstick pan (no oil), sauté onion, bell pepper, and leek.
Transfer to a pot with remaining vegetables and cover with water or broth.
Rinse quinoa well, add to pot, and bring to a boil. Simmer until tender.

title: Pumpkin Soup
ingredients: 1 large pumpkin or butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
preparation: In a nonstick pan, sauté onion with garlic and tomatoes.
Add broth and pumpkin and boil for about 30 minutes.
Let cool and blend until smooth.
Add seasonings and reheat before serving.

title: Spinach and Broccoli Soup
preparation: In a nonstick pan, sauté onions with garlic.
Add broth, broccoli, and spinach and boil for about 30 minutes.
Let cool and blend until smooth.
Add seasonings and reheat before serving.

title: Zucchini Tart
preparation: Wash and chop all vegetables.
Sauté them.
Add ricotta, eggs, and seeds.
Fill the tart crust and bake.

title: Leek and Carrot Soup
preparation: In a nonstick pan, sauté onions with leek.
Add broth and carrots and boil for about 30 minutes.
Let cool and blend until smooth.
Add seasonings and reheat before serving.

title: Pea Soup
preparation: In a nonstick pan, sauté onions with garlic.
Add broth and peas and boil for about 20 minutes.
Let cool and blend until smooth.
Add seasonings and reheat before serving.

title: Chicken and Pumpkin Pie
preparation: In a nonstick pan, sauté onion until translucent.
Add bell pepper and chicken pieces until chicken is cooked.
Add carrot and seasonings. Set aside.
Make mashed pumpkin with milk.
In a baking dish, place chicken filling and top with a layer of mashed pumpkin.
Bake at 350°F for a few minutes.

title: Tuna Burgers
ingredients: 1 can (5 oz) tuna in water, drained
preparation: Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
Wet your hands and form small balls.
Flatten between palms to form burger patties.
Cook in a nonstick pan or with cooking spray.

title: Beef Burgers
ingredients: Rolled oats or whole wheat breadcrumbs as needed
preparation: Mix everything (except oats/breadcrumbs) until well combined.
Form balls of desired size, then flatten to shape.
Coat with oats or whole wheat breadcrumbs.
Place on a baking sheet and bake.

title: Fish Fillet on a Bed of Vegetables
preparation: Boil fish fillet for 10 minutes.
Remove and drain well.
In a nonstick pan, sauté onion, bell pepper, and leek.
Place those vegetables with the rest on a baking sheet, forming a bed.
Place fish fillet on top and bake at low heat for a few minutes until golden.

title: Chicken and Veggie Wok
preparation: In a nonstick wok, sauté onion and bell peppers.
Add chicken and cook until done.
Add remaining vegetables and stir-fry.
Add soy sauce and bean sprouts.
Optional: top with chopped walnuts before serving.

title: Quinoa Pizza
preparation: Preheat oven.
In a bowl, mix all ingredients except cheese, sauce, and tomato.
Stir until homogeneous.
Place in a pizza pan and flatten with hands.
Top with sauce, cheese, and tomato; add basil and garlic.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Can be served with a side salad.

title: Quinoa Meatballs
preparation: Soak quinoa for a few minutes, drain, and rinse with cold water.
Boil with 1 cup water for 15–20 minutes.
In a nonstick pan, sauté vegetables with water or cooking spray.
Let quinoa cool.
Process/blend quinoa, sautéed vegetables, and lentils.
Add egg whites and mix.
Form balls and coat with breadcrumbs.
Bake for a few minutes.

title: Lentil Burgers
preparation: Mash or process cooked lentils (better if slightly overcooked).
Shred carrot and add.
Chop onion, garlic, and bell pepper; sauté with water in a nonstick pan until onion is translucent.
Mix sautéed vegetables with lentils.
Add egg white and let rest for a few minutes.
Form balls, flatten, and coat with oats/bran/breadcrumbs.
Cook on a griddle or bake.
notes: Can be frozen with parchment paper separators.

title: Textured Soy Meatballs
ingredients: 3.5 oz fine textured soy protein (about 10.5 oz rehydrated)
preparation: Rehydrate soy protein.
Drain and mix with oat flour, garlic, onion, pepper, salt, and parsley.
Blend for a few seconds until homogeneous.
Form meatballs and bake.

title: Seitan Cutlets
preparation: Mix all ingredients well.
Shape into small cutlets.
Boil for 8 minutes and freeze.
To cook: sear quickly on both sides on a griddle.

title: White Bean Stew
preparation: Soak beans overnight, then boil until tender.
For the sauce: chop onion, carrots, and bell pepper; sauté in a pan with a little water or cooking spray.
When onion is golden, add crushed/blended tomatoes (and water to taste).
Drain beans and mix with sauce.

title: Lentil Stew
ingredients: 1.1 lbs pumpkin or butternut squash, cubed
preparation: In a pot, boil squash cubes with lentils, bay leaves, and 3 cups water.
Dice carrots; chop onions, bell peppers, and garlic.
Sauté vegetables.
Add diced tomatoes and cook for about 10 minutes.
Add sautéed vegetables to the pot, season, and finish cooking together.

title: Zucchini Lasagna
preparation: Make a sauce with diced tomato, carrot, and seasonings; set aside.
In a nonstick pan, sauté onion; add bell pepper and chicken cubes until chicken is cooked.
In a baking dish, pour a little sauce and cover bottom with a layer of zucchini.
Add chicken filling and cheese cubes.
Repeat layers (zucchini, sauce, filling) until ingredients are used.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.

title: Stuffed Eggplant Neapolitan
ingredients: Small handful of cooked brown rice
preparation: Cut eggplant in half lengthwise.
Boil in water with vinegar and bay leaf until it loses rigidity. Drain and remove seeds.
Combine cooked rice with carrot, onion, and garlic.
Stuff eggplant with rice mixture.
Place in baking dish, cover with sauce, and bake at moderate heat for 15 minutes.
Top with cheese and bake until cheese melts.

title: Stuffed Zucchini
preparation: Boil whole zucchini for 10 minutes. Cool, cut in half, and scoop out.
Sauté chopped vegetables with zucchini pulp over low heat.
Mix vegetables with rice and stuff zucchini.
Bake until golden.

title: Pasta with Brussels Sprouts and Cherry Tomatoes
preparation: Boil Brussels sprouts for 3 minutes.
In a wok with oil or cooking spray, sauté onion.
When translucent, add halved Brussels sprouts and cherry tomatoes.
Add seeds, seasonings, and toss with cooked pasta.

title: Whole Wheat Pizza Dough
preparation: Make a well in the flour; in the center place yeast, oil, sugar, and part of the water.
Place salt on the outer edges.
Dissolve yeast with your fingers and gradually incorporate water with flour.
Form a ball and let rest for a few minutes.
Roll out in pizza pans and bake.

title: Beet Gnocchi
preparation: Boil beets (quartered) and add peeled potato halfway through cooking.
Drain beets, let water evaporate, and process until smooth purée.
Mash hot potato and let cool.
Mix both purées, form a well, and add egg, seasonings, and half the flour.
Knead, adding flour as needed until dough is smooth. Rest for 10 minutes.
Form cylinders and cut into pieces.

title: Gluten-Free Potato Gnocchi
ingredients: 14 oz gluten-free flour blend (14 oz corn starch, 10.5 oz cassava flour, 10.5 oz rice flour)
Salt, pepper, and nutmeg to taste
preparation: Boil potatoes and mash.
In a bowl, mix with eggs and combine well.
Gradually add flour blend until dough is smooth and doesn't stick.
Rest for a few minutes, form cylinders, and cut.

title: Gluten-Free Beet Gnocchi
ingredients: 14 oz gluten-free flour blend (see previous recipe)
Salt, pepper, and nutmeg to taste
preparation: Boil potatoes and beets; mash both together.
Mix with eggs and seasonings.
Gradually add flour blend until dough is smooth.
Rest, form cylinders, and cut.

title: Gluten-Free Dinner Rolls
preparation: Mix milk, yeast, and sugar; rest for 10 minutes.
Mix flour blend with salt; make a well and add oil, egg, and activated yeast.
Form homogeneous dough and let rise for 40 minutes.
Shape into rolls, place on baking sheet, sprinkle with seeds, and bake at medium heat for about 20 minutes.

title: Homemade Whole Wheat Bread
preparation: Dissolve yeast in 1/2 cup warm water; rest for 10 minutes.
Mix flour and salt in a bowl; make a well in center and add yeast.
Mix with hands, gradually adding remaining water.
Form dough and let rest for 30 minutes.
Bake for 30–40 minutes.

title: Cloud Bread
preparation: Mix yolk with cream cheese until smooth.
Add baking powder to egg whites and beat to stiff peaks.
Fold yolk mixture into whites with gentle motions.
Drop spoonfuls onto parchment-lined baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes at medium heat.

title: Vegan Omelet
preparation: Place ingredients in a bowl and blend or whisk.
Cook in a nonstick pan, flipping once.

title: Homemade Tacos
preparation: Mix polenta, flour, oil, and seasonings.
Add water until dough forms; knead and rest for a few minutes.
Divide into balls and roll into circles.
Cook in a nonstick pan, flipping once.
Fill as desired (e.g., sautéed vegetables).

title: Banana Muffins
ingredients: Optional: mixed nuts, dark chocolate, poppy seeds
preparation: Blend eggs, sugar, sweetener, and bananas.
Add dry ingredients and beat.
Fold in optionals and pour into muffin liners.
Bake at 375°F in preheated oven.

title: Blueberry Muffins
preparation: Mix dry ingredients in one bowl and wet in another.
Combine both mixtures without overmixing.
Toss blueberries in flour and fold into batter.
Pour into muffin tins and bake for 20–25 minutes.

title: Mandarin Muffins
preparation: Juice 2 mandarins and chop the other 2 (seedless).
Blend juice and chopped mandarins; add sugar and stevia and blend again.
Add oil, baking powder, and salt.
Transfer to a bowl and gradually add flour. Rest for 15 minutes.
Fill muffin liners and bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.

title: Pear Muffins
preparation: Beat eggs with sugar and stevia; add oil.
Shred pears and add to mixture with flour and baking powder.
Pour into muffin tins and bake at 350°F for about 25 minutes.

title: Sweet Veggie Muffins
ingredients: 3.5 oz carrot, finely chopped or shredded
preparation: Mix dry ingredients.
Add beaten eggs and oil to the center and combine.
Fold in zucchini and carrot.
Pour into muffin tins and bake for about 20 minutes.

title: Savory Muffins
ingredients: Flavorings: 1 garlic clove, 1/2 onion, 1/2 bell pepper
preparation: Mix flour blend and baking powder.
Beat egg whites and add to flour with milk until smooth batter forms.
Add oil and seasonings.
Sauté garlic, onion, and bell pepper; fold into batter.
Pour into muffin liners and bake at medium heat for about 15 minutes.

title: Pear Loaf
preparation: Blend pears, eggs, stevia, and vanilla.
Add whole wheat flour and baking powder.
Bake at medium heat until a toothpick comes out clean.

title: Apple Loaf
ingredients: 14 oz apples, peeled and thinly sliced
preparation: Mix dry ingredients (cornstarch, flours, baking powder, almonds, sugar, oats).
Add eggs, oil, and cream cheese; beat until smooth.
Fold in thinly sliced apples.
Pour into greased loaf pan and bake for 45 minutes at moderate heat.

title: Mandarin Loaf
preparation: Beat egg with salt and sugar until foamy.
Add oil, mandarin zest, and vanilla.
Add mandarin juice and oats.
Fold in whole wheat flour and baking powder.
Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes in a floured loaf pan.

title: Whole Wheat Lemon Poppy Seed Loaf
preparation: Beat eggs with zest, salt, sugar, and oil.
Mix sifted flour with baking powder and poppy seeds.
Add lemon juice to first mixture (top off with milk/water if needed to reach 1 cup).
Combine both mixtures and bake for about 30 minutes.

title: Banana Loaf
preparation: Blend bananas with lemon juice.
Beat egg, sugar, oil, and vanilla; add banana purée.
In another bowl, mix dry ingredients and fold into wet mixture.
Bake for 60 minutes at medium heat in a parchment-lined loaf pan.

title: Carrot Cookies
preparation: Mix shredded carrots with oil.
Fold in flours to form dough.
Roll out and cut with cookie cutters.
Bake for 25 minutes at medium heat.

title: Coconut Banana Cookies
preparation: Mash bananas and mix with coconut and sunflower seeds.
Drop spoonfuls onto nonstick baking sheet and shape into cookies.
Bake for 15 minutes at medium heat, flip, and bake a few more minutes.

title: Oat and Banana Pancakes
preparation: Mash banana, add egg whites and vanilla.
Fold in oats and mix.
Cook in hot nonstick pan, flipping once.

title: Chickpea Hummus
preparation: Place chickpeas, oil, lemon juice, and a few parsley leaves in a food processor.
Process until smooth and creamy.
Season to taste.
notes: Great for spreading on toast as a breakfast alternative.

title: Sugar-Free Blueberry Jam
preparation: Place cleaned blueberries in a hot pan.
Stir with a wooden spoon and mash lightly with a potato masher.
Add remaining ingredients and cook for 2 more minutes until desired consistency.
Cool and store in a sterilized jar. Refrigerate.

title: Blueberry Smoothie Bowl
preparation: Place all base ingredients in a bowl.
Blend until perfectly smooth.
Serve and top with granola, blueberries, and shredded coconut (or toppings of choice).

title: Almond and Coconut Granola
preparation: Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
Spread mixture on a baking sheet.
Preheat oven for 15 minutes.
Bake at medium heat for 15–20 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool for 1 hour.
Serve with fresh fruit.

title: Matcha Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: Base: 1/4 cup plant-based milk of choice
preparation: Place all base ingredients in a food processor or blender.
Blend until perfectly smooth.
Serve in a shallow bowl with desired toppings.

title: Whole Wheat Waffles
preparation: Mix all ingredients in a bowl until smooth batter forms.
Pour batter into waffle maker following equipment instructions.

title: French Toast
preparation: Mix egg with milk.
Soak bread slices on both sides.
Cook in nonstick pan, flipping once.
Serve with fruit, seeds, tomato, or arugula.

title: Mediterranean Toast
preparation: Blend or process tomato with olive oil drizzle.
Serve toast or fresh bread slices with this mixture.

title: Caprese Omelet
preparation: Pour beaten egg and egg white into nonstick pan.
Cook for a few minutes over low heat.
Flip omelet and place cheese cubes on top until melted.
Fold omelet and serve with tomato and basil.

title: Protein Brownies
ingredients: 5.3 oz cocoa powder (or 3 scoops chocolate whey protein)
3 egg whites, beaten to stiff peaks
preparation: In a bowl, mix yolks, cream cheese, cornstarch, cocoa (or protein powder), sweetener, and baking powder.
Beat egg whites to stiff peaks and gently fold into mixture.
Bake for 20 minutes.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: Chocolate chips or chopped dark chocolate
preparation: Mix oil with sugar and vanilla.
Add beaten egg.
Gradually add flour until smooth batter forms.
Fold in chocolate chips (about 1/3 cup).
Refrigerate dough for 20 minutes.
Roll out dough, cut shapes, and bake at low heat for 20 minutes.

title: Oat Energy Balls
ingredients: Optional: crushed nuts or scoop of protein powder
preparation: Mix all ingredients (except coconut) in a bowl.
Form balls and roll in shredded coconut.
Place on a tray and freeze until firm.
notes: Can use crushed crackers if oats are unavailable.
For protein version, replace cocoa with protein powder or add skim milk powder.

title: Cashew Cheese Spread
preparation: Soak cashews in water for 30 minutes to 24 hours.
Rinse and discard soaking water.
Process cashews with remaining ingredients until smooth and creamy.
Refrigerate covered until serving.

title: Sunflower Seed Spread
preparation: Soak sunflower seeds in water for 6–8 hours.
Place in food processor with a little water (about 1/2 cup) and blend.
Add salt, herbs, and lemon juice.
Blend until desired consistency.

title: Oat Milk
preparation: Soak oats in plenty of water for at least 5 hours.
Drain, rinse, and place in blender with 4 cups water.
Blend for a few seconds until liquid is white and oats dissolve.
Strain through fine-mesh strainer and discard pulp.
Pour into bottle and cover.

title: Sunflower Seed Milk
preparation: Soak seeds in plenty of water for at least 4 hours.
Drain, rinse, and place in blender with 4 cups water.
Blend for a few seconds until liquid is white.
Strain through fine-mesh strainer and discard pulp.
Pour into bottle and cover.

title: Seed Crackers
preparation: Soak walnuts, sunflower seeds, and pumpkin seeds for 8 hours or overnight. Drain.
Soak flaxseeds for 30 minutes.
Shred carrot and finely chop bell pepper, onion, and celery.
Mix everything in a bowl and process until moist paste forms.
Spread mixture on a baking sheet and bake at low heat for a few minutes.

title: Chewy Banana Bites
ingredients: 3 ripe bananas, peeled and sliced into 3/4 to 1-inch thick rounds
preparation: Preheat oven to 250°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper and brush with about 1 tablespoon coconut oil.
In a small bowl, combine remaining 1 tablespoon coconut oil, lemon juice, cinnamon, and salt.
Spread bananas evenly on baking sheet and brush each slice with lemon mixture.
Bake in center of oven for 2 hours. After 1 hour, remove from oven, use tongs to flip each banana slice, and return to oven.
Place baking sheet on wire rack to cool completely. Store in glass jar or airtight container for up to 1 month.

title: Power Muffins
ingredients: 1 cup old-fashioned rolled oats (gluten-free if sensitive)
1/2 cup raisins, chopped dates, or chocolate chips (optional)
preparation: Place rack in center of oven. Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a standard 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners.
In a large bowl, combine almond flour, oats, cinnamon, nutmeg, baking soda, salt, and nuts/raisins/dates/chips (if using).
In a separate bowl, mix eggs, zucchini, carrots, butter, maple syrup, and vanilla.
Add wet ingredients to dry and stir until combined (batter will be thick).
Pour batter into muffin cups, filling to the top.
Bake until well-browned on top and toothpick comes out clean: 25–35 minutes.

title: My Everyday Oatmeal
ingredients: 1 cup old-fashioned rolled oats (gluten-free if sensitive)
4 cups unsweetened almond milk or milk of choice
Optional toppings: fresh berries, chia or sunflower seeds, walnuts, toasted coconut flakes, dates or other dried fruit
preparation: In a medium bowl, combine oats, milk, yogurt, honey, cinnamon, vanilla (if using), and salt.
Cover and let soak for at least 1 hour or refrigerate overnight.
Stir in shredded apple. If too thick, add more milk.
Divide between 2 bowls and add optional toppings as desired.

title: My Race Day Oatmeal
ingredients: 1/4 cup almond milk or milk of choice
preparation: Combine oats, banana, salt, and 3/4 cup water in a microwave-safe bowl.
Microwave on high for 1–2 minutes, or until thickened.
Lightly mash banana and add milk.
Top with nut or almond butter and raisins or berries.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and drizzle with honey if desired.

title: Post-Workout Breakfast Burritos
ingredients: 1 bag (6 oz) baby spinach (about 4 cups packed)
1 1/2 cups shredded Gruyère or favorite cheese
1 1/2 cups spicy black beans or 1 can (15 oz), drained
preparation: Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add spinach and cook until wilted.
Add eggs, salt, and pepper and cook, stirring continuously, until scrambled. Remove from heat.
Place each tortilla on a sheet of foil (12 x 12 inches) and sprinkle with 1/4 cup cheese.
Divide egg and spinach mixture among 6 tortillas (in a strip down center) and top each with 1/4 cup beans.
Roll each tortilla like a burrito (folding top and bottom in) and wrap tightly in foil.
Place together in a large freezer bag and freeze for up to 2 months.
To reheat: unwrap foil, place on microwave-safe plate, and heat 2–3 minutes, turning after 1 minute.

title: Banana French Toast
ingredients: 1/4 cup unsweetened almond milk or milk of choice
Twist of freshly ground black pepper
8 slices 1-inch-thick bread (spelt or bread of choice)
Optional: coarse sea salt, sliced bananas, maple syrup
preparation: In an 8 x 8-inch baking dish (or shallow bowl), whisk eggs, milk, cinnamon, almond extract, salt, nutmeg (if using), and pepper.
Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Dip each bread slice in egg mixture (coating both sides) and place on a plate.
Place 4 slices in skillet, pouring a bit more egg mixture on top. Fry until browned (1–2 minutes).
Flip and brown second side.
If butter burns, wipe with paper towel, add another tablespoon of butter, and repeat with remaining slices.
Serve with coarse sea salt, sliced bananas, and/or maple syrup (optional).

title: My Granola Recipe
ingredients: 2.3 oz mixed seeds (chia, sesame, pumpkin, sunflower, etc.)
2.6 oz dried cranberries, raisins, or dried fruit of choice
preparation: Preheat oven to 340°F and prepare a large baking sheet.
In a saucepan, heat coconut oil with honey (or syrup) and vanilla.
Mix oats, nuts (whole or chopped), seeds, and cinnamon.
Pour melted coconut oil and honey over oat mixture and stir.
Reserve cranberries/raisins for after baking.
Spread mixture on baking sheet and bake for about 25 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes.
Let cool completely.
Add reserved dried fruit and store in airtight jar.

title: Energy Bites (Perfect Replacement for Store-Bought Bars)
preparation: In a food processor, combine dates, cherries, walnuts, almond butter, cocoa, coffee, and salt.
Pulse to chop, then process for 1–2 minutes, scraping sides if needed, until mixture begins to clump.
Transfer to a bowl and form 24 walnut-size balls.
Roll each ball in toasted coconut.
Store in airtight container for up to 1 month or freeze for up to 6 months.

title: Cornmeal Scones with Blueberries and Lemon
ingredients: 1/4 cup coconut sugar or granulated sugar
1 stick (8 tablespoons) cold unsalted butter, cubed
preparation: Place rack in center of oven. Preheat to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, mix cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Using fingers or pastry cutter, work butter into dry ingredients until pea-sized.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, yogurt, vanilla, and lemon zest. Add to dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Fold in blueberries (batter will be thick and sticky).
On a floured surface, form into a semi-flat log about 2 inches in diameter and cut into 10 triangles; place separated on baking sheet.
Alternative: drop large spoonfuls of batter onto sheet.
Bake 15–20 minutes until lightly browned on bottom. Cool on wire rack.

title: Spiced Hazelnuts
preparation: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.
Melt butter over medium-low heat. Add cinnamon and red pepper and cook for 1 minute, stirring.
Remove from heat and stir in honey and salt. Add hazelnuts and stir to coat.
Spread on baking sheet and roast for 15 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes.
Cool completely in a single layer, break up clusters, and store in jar.

title: Fig, Cheese, and Thyme Toasts
ingredients: 1/2 large or 1 small baguette (about 1 foot), sliced 1/2-inch thick
4–5 fresh figs, thinly sliced (or 1/2 ripe pear, thinly sliced)
preparation: Set oven to broil with rack on top shelf.
Place baguette slices on baking sheet and drizzle one side generously with oil.
Broil until lightly golden (about 1 minute). Remove, flip, and broil second side (30 seconds to 1 minute).
Rub one side of each toast with garlic and transfer to serving platter.
Top with goat cheese, fig (or pear), a drizzle of honey, thyme, and salt.

title: Turmeric Pepitas (Post-Workout Snack)
preparation: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.
Melt butter over medium-low heat. Add turmeric and curry and cook for about 1 minute, stirring.
Turn off heat and stir in honey and salt. Add pepitas and stir to coat.
Spread on baking sheet and roast for 10 minutes, stirring after 5 minutes.
Cool completely; they become crispy as they cool. Break up clusters and store in jar.

title: Fresh Greens Salad with Grilled Salmon
ingredients: 1/4 lb wild salmon or Arctic char, in 2 fillets
1/2 cup crumbled goat cheese or feta
preparation: Preheat grill to medium-high (or oven broiler with rack on top).
Drizzle oil over salmon and asparagus and season with salt and pepper.
Grill salmon 2–3 minutes per side (depending on thickness) and asparagus 3–4 minutes, rotating.
Oven alternative: place on foil-lined baking sheet and broil until salmon is opaque (6–10 min) and asparagus is lightly charred (3–4 min).
Assemble salad bowls with arugula/greens. Top with blueberries, hazelnuts, and cheese.
Cut asparagus into 2-inch pieces. Place a salmon fillet and asparagus on each salad and drizzle with dressing.

title: Double Chocolate Cookies
preparation: In a large bowl, mix teff flour, almond flour, chocolate chips, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add maple syrup, coconut oil, and vanilla; stir until combined.
Optional: cover dough and refrigerate overnight for a softer cookie.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment.
Drop spoonfuls of dough about 1 inch apart.
Bake for 12 minutes (until bottom is lightly golden). Cool for 5 minutes, then transfer to wire rack.

title: Chocolate Nut Butter Truffles with Sea Salt
ingredients: Coating: 1 teaspoon coarse sea salt (for finishing)
preparation: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with parchment.
For nut butter: roast walnuts for 8 minutes, stirring after 4 minutes. Cool completely.
Process walnuts, dates, and cinnamon until thick paste forms (don't over-process).
Form bite-size balls and place on baking sheet. If too soft, chill.
For coating: melt coconut oil (microwave in short bursts or saucepan). Mix with maple syrup and cocoa until smooth.
Dip each ball in chocolate, drain excess with fork, and return to sheet. Top with a pinch of sea salt.
Refrigerate 10–15 minutes until firm.
Store in airtight container (with parchment) in fridge for up to 1 week or freezer for up to 3 months.

title: Oregon Berry Crumble
preparation: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a bowl, toss strawberries, blueberries, cornstarch, and honey. Pour into 8 x 8-inch baking dish.
In another bowl, combine oats, almond flour, walnuts, coconut oil, maple syrup, cinnamon, and salt.
Sprinkle topping evenly over fruit.
Bake for 30–35 minutes until topping is golden and fruit is bubbling.
Cool for at least 10 minutes before serving.
